text: The Mansu Hill Grand Monument is a group of monuments in Pyongyang, North Korea. There are 229 figures in total. The two central 66 ft tall figures represent Kim Il-Sung and Kim Jong-il. Revealed in 1972, at first only Kim Il- Sung was present, Kim Jong-Il was added in 2012. == References == Category:1972 establishments in Asia Category:Buildings and structures in North Korea Category:Establishments in North Korea Category:Monuments and memorials Category:Pyongyang
title: Mansu Hill Grand Monument
